message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SP, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with the problem of support recovery of sparse signals based on multiple measurement vectors, which is a problem in signal processing and information theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.SP (Signal Processing) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the structure of the matrix formed by the nonzero entries, which is related to linear algebra and machine learning, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a likely sub-category as well. The paper also uses mathematical optimization techniques to derive sufficient and necessary conditions for successful support recovery, which is related to numerical analysis, making cs.NA (Numerical Analysis) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the benefits of using multiple measurement vectors for sparse signal recovery, which is related to multi-dimensional signal processing, making cs.MM (Multimedia) a possible sub-category.
